title: Grant Thornton: Strategic Analysis
text:
Overview
For our Business Strategy group project,we all had to work in teams of six and act as business consultants and assess a company based on their strategic advantages, resources/capabilities and possible weaknesses.This project was year-long and followed four key stages of strategy consulting: Orientation, Diagnostics, Intervention, and Evaluation
My group chose Grant Thornton as I have previous experience from working for the firm, and felt my experience and knowledge of this firm would be invaluable to the group.
View Full strategy Here


Strategic Highlights

Competition: Competing for brand recognition against the Big Four.
Technology: Investing in AI, automation, and data analytics to stay competitive.
Workforce: Emphasizing culture, career development, and talent retention.
Client Relations: Strengthening trust and insights through client retention.
Sustainability: Expanding ESG services to meet market expectations.



Diagnostics Summary

Opportunities: Expand advisory services and sustainability consulting.
Threats: Big Four competition and regulatory changes.
Strengths: Global presence, tech investments, personalized services.
Weaknesses: Lagging ESG initiatives and talent development challenges.



Key Recommendations

Define KPIs for market expansion.
Introduce cross-functional teams and RPA.
Enhance employee training and stakeholder engagement.
Strengthen ESG leadership and analytics capabilities.



Final Note
Grant Thornton‚Äôs focus on mid-market specialization, innovation, and ESG leadership positions it well for sustainable growth and differentiation in the professional services market.

title: About
text:
Hello my name is Liam Cummins, I am a final year studient at Dublin City University (DCU), where I am currently pursuing a, undergraduate degree in Business Studies. Before pursuing this course I had completed a two-year Post Leaving Certificate (PLC) course in Business Management at Col√°iste Dh√∫laigh College of Further Education. I‚Äôve found my plc to be vital in helping my educational development, specifically in growing my confidence and building a foundation of business knowledge I can apply to the workforce or for further progression.
With the necessary education qualifications, from Col√°iste Dh√∫laigh, I was offered direct entry into Year 2 of DCU‚Äôs Business Studies course. From then on I have completed year 2, conducted an internship with Grant Thornton as part of my year 3, and am on track to graduate year 4, with a chosen specialisim on Data Analytics.

title: About
text:
Professional Experience

Finance Intern ‚Äì Grant Thornton Ireland
During my internship at Grant Thornton, I worked in the FAAS (Financial Accounting and Advisory Services) department. I was assigned to two international teams: SEI US and State Street US.
My responsibilities included: - Preparing and reviewing second-level funds. - Assisting with fund accounting and compliance checks. - Ensuring timely and accurate documentation for reviewers. - Collaborating with team members across different regions.
This experience helped me develop a strong attention to detail, reinforced my ability to work under pressure, and allowed me to gain real-world exposure to large-scale financial operations. It also introduced me to the importance of client-focused work, deadline management, and the importance of teamwork in professional environments.
Most importantly, my time at Grant Thornton helped solidify my passion for roles that blend finance, strategy, and analytics ‚Äî and I was grateful to form long-lasting connections with mentors and peers during the placement.

title: About
text:
Career Goals
As I approach graduation, I‚Äôm actively exploring graduate roles in marketing, business analytics, or procurement. I‚Äôm excited to bring my academic learning, technical skills, and real-world experience to a dynamic organisation where I can contribute to growth, solve problems creatively, and continue developing as a professional.
In the long term, after I have gain enough valuable experience in the business world, I aim to become an entrepreneur and start my own company that will use business innovation to help the disadvantaged in Ireland and hopefully expand worldwide.

title: Bank Loan Prediction ‚Äì Machine Learning Model
text:
In this project, I developed machine learning models to predict bank loan approvals based on applicant financial and demographic data.
This included data preprocessing, feature engineering, model training, and performance evaluation.





Python (pandas, scikit-learn, matplotlib)
Models Built:

Random Forest Classifier
Decision Tree Classifier
Logistic Regression
Support Vector Machine (SVM)









Model
Accuracy (%)
F1-Score




Random Forest
97.9
0.98


Decision Tree
97.3
0.97


Logistic Regression
79.9
0.79


SVM
62.8
0.48




Random Forest achieved the best performance overall.






ROC Curves for model comparison
Pie charts showing class distribution
Confusion matrices to interpret predictions





This project improved my skills in machine learning model development, model evaluation, and interpretation of results for real-world applications.
It also highlighted the importance of balancing model complexity with interpretability when making decisions in finance and banking.
